speaker: Ses04M_script01_3_F026
dialog: And your money, there's nothing wrong in your money. Your father put hundreds of planes in the air. You should be proud. A man should be paid for that.

speaker: Ses04M_script01_3_M037
dialog: Annie, Annie, I'm going to make you a fortune.

speaker: Ses04M_script01_3_F027
dialog: What'll I do with a fortune?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M000
dialog: What time is it? They're supposed to run around midnight. This is great, isn't it? Look at this night we've got here; couldn't be better.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M001
dialog: Actually, I wanted to go a little farther up the coast, get away from the lights and the people, but I was afraid we'd miss it. How you doing?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F000
dialog: Fine.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M002
dialog: Is that, is that - is that just foam? I can't even tell. Although, if you can't tell, it's probably isn't them. It'll probably be unmistakable, don't you think?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M003
dialog: How you doing? Oh, no, you know what I did? I forgot to bring my flashlight. How could I be so stupid? I should have brought my flashlight.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F001
dialog: What flashlight?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M004
dialog: The flashlight; the silver one. There's only one, isn't there?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F002
dialog: It's not yours.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M005
dialog: Whose is it?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F003
dialog: It's ours. It's mine, too.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M006
dialog: Well, sure.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F004
dialog: You kept saying my flashlight as if it's somehow just yours. How is that supposed to make me feel?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M007
dialog: No, of course, our flashlight; yours and mine. Me flashlight es su flashlight, naturally. How could we not think to bring it? I hope the moon stays out.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M008
dialog: I wonder, do they always run during a full moon? I can't remember if it was full last year. Remember?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F005
dialog: Yes.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M009
dialog: Are you cold? Do you want my jacket? We should have brought the blanket, our blanket.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M010
dialog: Oh, man. This is great. I didn't even think to bring a six pack. Six pack would be just the ticket right about now. I can't believe I forgot. I'm like a kid. It's amazing I got out of the house with my fly zipped. Oh.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M011
dialog: I wonder if they can hear me talk or feel the vibrations in the sand when we move around.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F006
dialog: I'm cold.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M012
dialog: You want my jacket?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F007
dialog: It's after eleven; let's go home.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M013
dialog: Are you kidding? We'd miss it. We just got here. What's the point of coming down here if we just turn around and go home?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F008
dialog: There is no point in coming down here.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M014
dialog: Right.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F009
dialog: That's my point.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M015
dialog: That's my point, too.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F010
dialog: So let's go home.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M016
dialog: No, no, no. That's not my point. My point is is that there's no point in coming down here if we just leave. Don't you want to see it?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F011
dialog: Not particularly.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M017
dialog: Why not?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F012
dialog: I just don't. It's stupid.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M018
dialog: Honey, this is a natural phenomenon. I mean, this only happens once a year. It's a great opportunity. Think about the people in Kansas. They'd have to get plane tickets and hotel reservations to come see this. We're just forty minutes away. It's too good to pass up.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F013
dialog: Pass up what? These little fish swim onto the beach, flop around and then they swim away. And then they die.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M019
dialog: Yeah, but that moment on the beach is the highlight of their little lives. I mean, all that flopping around is laying eggs or what do you -- spawning or mating, something like that.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M020
dialog: There's mystery here and magic.

speaker: M:
dialog: did I fuck up?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F014
dialog: What are you so excited about?

speaker: F:
dialog: night.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M021
dialog: Oh, it's a big night for these guys. Uh, life's last orgy.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F015
dialog: This isn't a moon landing we're talking about. It's fish. It's fish nobody even eats.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M022
dialog: Yeah, they do. Okay. But it's fish who do something none of the other fish do; like the swallows are returning to Capistrano; or the lemmings throwing themselves off the cliffs, like that.

speaker: F:
dialog: Augie.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M023
dialog: There's mystery here and magic; a little bit of the unexplainable. I don't see how you can not be interested.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F016
dialog: I'm just not.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M024
dialog: For real?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F017
dialog: Yes.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M025
dialog: I don't get it. First time we came here to see it, you said it was the best night of your life. And last year, I remember distinctly you were so excited to get here, you stubbed your toe rushing me out the door and didn't even notice until we were in the car.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F018
dialog: Last year, you will also remember, our shoes got wet. I got sand in my panties. We got into a big fight over nothing. You got a sore throat and we did not see the grunions.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M026
dialog: We weren't in a good spot.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F019
dialog: We didn't see them the first time either.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M027
dialog: We just weren't in a good spot. This is a much better spot. I've got good instincts for these things. Look there. What's that? Is that -

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M028
dialog: no, it's just seaweed, isn't it? Oh, man, this is great. I wouldn't miss this for anything. I mean, think about this. I know you're not interested, but just think about this for a minute.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M029
dialog: Out there someplace is this huge mass of silver fish heading this way. They don't know why. We don't know why. It wasn't a decision. They didn't take a vote. No one sent them an invitation or a map;

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M030
dialog: just some little instinctual time release firecracker went off in their little bodies and all as one, they turned and formed a line as long as the California coast and started swimming.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M031
dialog: They're swimming right now as if that's the only thing that matters. It's single mindedness with no mind. Urgency that's pure urge.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M032
dialog: They don't know what drives them. They don't give it a name or ask a question. They just turn, as one, and start the swim that brings them here; to this place, where we stand, for a massive celebration of sex and death. Oh, man, I'm giving myself goose bumps. All my hairs are popping up.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F020
dialog: That's the wind.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_M033
dialog: Well so what did you think?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_1_F021
dialog: About what?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F000
dialog: Look at this, goose bumps.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M000
dialog: Well so what'd you think?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F001
dialog: About what?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M001
dialog: What I said.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F002
dialog: It's ridiculous.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M002
dialog: Certainly is not. It's slightly exaggerated scientific fact.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F003
dialog: It's PR. Somebody sold you a bill of goods that this wonderful event is going to take place on the beach.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M003
dialog: I'm not the only one. Look at these people.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F004
dialog: Sure. They're all told the same story. It's what keeps us coming back for more; keeps us excited; keeps us thinking that life is going to start any minute now if we could just find the right spot; get in on the action.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M004
dialog: Are we talking about the same thing?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F005
dialog: Well, I'm sorry, but it's still just fish to me.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M005
dialog: Carla, can I ask you something? Don't take this the wrong way, but are you having your period?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F006
dialog: Goddamn it, Augie, don't ask me that. I hate it when you ask me that. You always ask me that. It's insulting.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M006
dialog: Well what's bugging you?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F007
dialog: We just have different ideas about what this evening is supposed to look like.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M007
dialog: There's nothing to it. We come down here. The grunions arrive. They do their little fish business. We go ooh, ah, look at the fish. They go home. We go home.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F008
dialog: For heaven's sake, we are not going to see the grunions.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M008
dialog: Why not?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F009
dialog: We never do, do we? Have we ever?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M009
dialog: We've missed them twice.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M010
dialog: That's not ever.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F010
dialog: Twice is every time we've tried. That's ever.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M011
dialog: We'll see them this year.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F011
dialog: No, we won't. It's pointless. It's like waiting up to see Santa Claus. I feel as though my entire life is going to be spent standing on the beach with my eyes wide open and my hands clasped expectantly waiting for the fish to show up. And the fish won't show up.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M012
dialog: I thought you wanted to see them.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F012
dialog: You don't have any idea what I'm saying.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M013
dialog: No, of course, not.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F013
dialog: I did want to see it. I always do. I keep thinking this time will be the time, but it never is.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M014
dialog: It's just fish; nothing to get traumatized over.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F014
dialog: For heaven's sake, this is not about fish.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M015
dialog: I've been trying to work this backwards, but I can't seem to pinpoint the moment when we took a turn for the worse.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M016
dialog: You were fine during the phone call from Marge. Dinner was okay. Doing the dishes was no problem. Let's see, I took a shower. Uh, you watched the news. You said the grunions are running tonight. I said great, let's go. I feel lucky tonight.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M017
dialog: Uh,okay. So I'm putting on my jacket; putting out the animals;

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F015
dialog: Do you remember the first time we came to see it?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M018
dialog: uh, taking the car out of the gara- out of the garage.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M019
dialog: Uh.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F016
dialog: It was about four years ago, right after we got married. We thought I was pregnant and we had a bottle of champagne but no glasses. You asked me to dance. So we took off our shoes and you popped the cork.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F017
dialog: And while we were dancing, you said the softest, most intimate things to me, right into my ear so that I could feel them as much as hear them. And I remember thinking this is it. At last, at last I'm as happy as I'm supposed to be.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M020
dialog: Wait a minute, I've got it.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F018
dialog: Dancing barefoot in the sand; drinking champagne from the bottle.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M021
dialog: It was in the car, right? Driving past the Knickerbocker Liquor Locker? You said let's get some champagne and I said times a wasting or something like that. Right? That's it, right? You want this to be like the other time. That's it. Of course.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F019
dialog: I'd rather not remember some things. I'd rather not hope for some things.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M022
dialog: Sure. Okay. Alright. I've got it. Listen do you want to dance?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F020
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M023
dialog: You want to get some champagne?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F021
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M024
dialog: What, you want me to breathe in your ear?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F022
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M025
dialog: You want to get married again?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F023
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M026
dialog: What, you want a divorce?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F024
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M027
dialog: A vacation?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F025
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M028
dialog: A new carpet? A poodle? An ice cream? A back rub? A suicide pact? What? What, Carla? What the hell do you want?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F026
dialog: I want something to turn out the way it's supposed to.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M029
dialog: Well welcome to the human race. You think this is what I had in mind? You think that when I proposed, I had this great fantasy going that four years down the line, we'd come to the beach and yell at each other over fish? No.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M030
dialog: No, I'm just like you. I thought it was going to be all peaches and roses and wind in our hair and sand in our toes and the fish will always come and the bills will always pay themselves.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M031
dialog: And we'll have three fat rosy kids and ha, ha, ha, baby, the joke's on us, 'cause you know what you get, Carla? You know what you get? This.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F027
dialog: This what? What is this? This isn't even anything.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M032
dialog: Yes, it is.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F028
dialog: Oh, right, sure. This is standing on the beach. This is waiting. This is fighting.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M033
dialog: Right.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F029
dialog: But this isn't anything like I thought anything would be like.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M034
dialog: No, I know, me neither.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F030
dialog: This is just this. I mean, it includes a lot and everything, but it's just not, you know, something else. Do you have any idea what I'm trying to say?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M035
dialog: I'm doing the best I can.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F031
dialog: I know you are, Augie. Really, I do. I know you meant for this to be special and nice and it's the full moon and the sand and everything. But I just couldn't help thinking about being somewhere else.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M036
dialog: Maybe if you were with somebody else, too, huh?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F032
dialog: I didn't say that.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M037
dialog: No, I know. But still. I know I don't make you happy.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F033
dialog: For heaven's sake, whatever I'm doing, I'd rather be doing it with you.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M038
dialog: Yeah?

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F034
dialog: Well don't be ridiculous. Don't you know that? You're the one who probably wishes you were with somebody else; somebody who knew how to enjoy herself and didn't take everything so hard.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M039
dialog: Actually, now that you mention it, no. I don't.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F035
dialog: Okay, fine. So we're in the wrong spot, but we're with the right person.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M040
dialog: I don't know. It seemed like a good spot to me. I mean, look at the view you've got of the moon from here.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F036
dialog: Yeah, I noticed that. Looks pretty on the water, doesn't it? Big ol' white moon. I'm sorry, Augie.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M041
dialog: Shh. If we're very quiet, the fish might come.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_F037
dialog: Or not.

speaker: Ses04M_script02_2_M042
dialog: Or not.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M000
dialog: Good God.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F000
dialog: Do you think it's them?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M001
dialog: I wonder.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F001
dialog: Nobody knows we're here, except Freda and she wouldn't ring up.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M002
dialog: It must be them, then.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F002
dialog: What are we to do?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M003
dialog: We'll be alright, darling. Whatever happens, aren't we?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F003
dialog: Now and always sweet.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M004
dialog: I don't care, then.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F004
dialog: It was bound to come sooner or later.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M005
dialog: Hello, hello. What? Wrong number.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F005
dialog: Oh, it sent shivers up my spine.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M006
dialog: What shall we do if they suddenly walk in on us?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F006
dialog: Behave exquisitely.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M007
dialog: With the mo- with the most perfect poise?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F007
dialog: Certainly. I shall probably do a court curtsey.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M008
dialog: Ah. Things that ought to matter dreadfully don't matter when one's happy, do they?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F008
dialog: But what's so horrible is that one can't stay happy.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M009
dialog: Don't say that, darling.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F009
dialog: It's true. The whole business is a very poor joke.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M010
dialog: Meaning that sacred and beautiful thing, love?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F010
dialog: Yes, meaning just that.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M011
dialog: What does it all mean? That's what I ask myself in my ceaseless quest for ultimate truth. Dear God, what does it all mean?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F011
dialog: Don't laugh at me. I'm serious.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M012
dialog: You mustn't be serious, my dear. That's just what they want.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F012
dialog: Who's they?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M013
dialog: All the futile moralists who try to make life unbearable. Laugh at them. Be flippant. Laugh at everything. All their sacred shibboleths. Flippancy brings out the acid- acid in their damn sweetness and light.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F013
dialog: If I laugh at everything, I must laugh at us, too.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M014
dialog: Certainly you must. We're figures of fun alright.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F014
dialog: How long will it last, this ludicrous and overbearing love of ours?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M015
dialog: Who knows.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F015
dialog: Shall we always want to bicker and fight?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M016
dialog: No. That fire will fade along with our passion.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F016
dialog: Oh, dear. Should we like that.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M017
dialog: It all depends on how well we've played.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F017
dialog: What happens if one of us dies? Does the one that's left, still laugh?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M018
dialog: Yes. Yes, with all his might.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F018
dialog: Well that's serious enough, isn't it?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M019
dialog: No, no, it isn't. Death's very laughable; such a cunning little mystery, all done with mirrors.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F019
dialog: Darling, I believe you're talking nonsense.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M020
dialog: So is everyone else in the long run. Let's be superficial and pity the poor philosophers. Let's blow trumpets and squeakers and- and enjoy the party as much as we can, like very small, quite idiotic little school children.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M021
dialog: Let's savor the delight of the moment. Come and kiss me, darling, before your body rots and worms pop in and out of your eye sockets.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F020
dialog: Elliot, worms don't pop.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M022
dialog: I don't mind what you do, see? You can paint yourself bright green all over and dance naked in the Place Vendome and rush off madly with all the men in the world and I shan't say a word as long as you love me best.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F021
dialog: Thank you, dear. The same applies to you, except that if I catch you so much as looking at another woman, I will kill you.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M023
dialog: Do you remember that awful scene we had in Venice?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F022
dialog: Which particular one?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M024
dialog: The one when you bought that little painted wooded snake and put it on my bed?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F023
dialog: Oh, Charles; that was his name, Charles. Oh, he did wriggle so beautifully.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M025
dialog: Horrible thing. I hated it.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F024
dialog: I know you did. You threw it out of the window into the Grand Canal. I don't think I'll ever forgive you for that.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M026
dialog: How long did that row last?

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F025
dialog: It went on intermittently for days.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_M027
dialog: The worst one was in Cannes when your curling irons burnt holes in my dressing gown.

speaker: Ses04M_script03_1_F026
dialog: It burnt my comb, too, and all the towels in the bathroom.

dialog: Line?

dialog: How ridiculous. How utterly, utterly ridiculous.

dialog: Yes. We were very much younger then.

dialog: And very much sillier.
